abstract: General Electric said Monday it had agreed to sell its struggling GE Plastics business to Riyadh-based chemicals company Saudi Basic Industries in an $11.6 billion cash deal. G.E. said it would receive net after-tax proceeds of about $9 billion, which would be primarily put toward the company’s current stock buyback.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said Monday it had agreed to sell its struggling GE Plastics business to Riyadh-based chemicals company Saudi Basic Industries in an $11.6 billion cash deal. G.E. said it would receive net after-tax proceeds of about $9 billion, which would be primarily put toward the company’s current stock buyback.

headline.main: G.E. to Sell Plastics Unit for $11.6 Billion
